bill_title: to allow a multifamily housing owner, operator, or leasing agent to verify certain criminal conviction information on a lease application.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow a multifamily housing owner, operator, or leasing agent to verify certain criminal conviction information on a lease application. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 43-32 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: For the purpose of assisting an owner, operator, or leasing agent for a rental unit of multifamily housing, such person may require a prospective renter to complete an application including a true and accurate representation of the applicant's criminal conviction record. The owner, operator, or leasing agent for the rental unit may submit the criminal conviction record portion of the completed application to a local law enforcement agency or to the Division of Criminal Investigation for a criminal conviction record check. This criminal conviction record check shall confirm or deny the accuracy of the applicant's criminal conviction record as stated on the application. The owner, operator, or leasing agent for the rental unit shall be informed only as to whether or not the applicant accurately completed the application. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
